data.title: [android] Dead lock in wilhelm (OpenSLES) while destroying OpenSLES object right after it was initialized
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.15.1
- devices test on: Android 7.0
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

```c++
    schedule([](float dt){
        for (int i = 0; i < 20; ++i) {
            AudioEngine::play2d("fonts/audio_music_004.mp3");
            std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(5));
            AudioEngine::stopAll();
        }
    }, "bbbb");
```

Result:
```
06-28 15:38:30.240 6674-6707/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test V/UrlAudioPlayer: Current UrlAudioPlayer instance count: 1
06-28 15:38:30.240 6674-6707/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test V/UrlAudioPlayer: UrlAudioPlayer::prepare: assets/fonts/audio_music_004.mp3, SL_DATALOCATOR_ANDROIDFD, 52, 468084, 1454144
06-28 15:38:30.251 6674-6707/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test V/UrlAudioPlayer: UrlAudioPlayer::stop (0xe36c9020, 9746)
06-28 15:38:30.251 6674-6707/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test V/AudioEngineImpl: Removing player id=9746, state:4
06-28 15:38:30.251 6674-6707/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test V/UrlAudioPlayer: UrlAudioPlayer::destroy() 0xe36c9020
06-28 15:38:30.263 6674-7250/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test E/libOpenSLES: frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:785: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
06-28 15:38:30.283 6674-7250/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test E/libOpenSLES: frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:785: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
06-28 15:38:30.313 6674-7250/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test E/libOpenSLES: frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:785: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
06-28 15:38:30.354 6674-7250/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test E/libOpenSLES: frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:785: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
06-28 15:38:30.404 6674-7250/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test E/libOpenSLES: frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:785: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
06-28 15:38:30.504 6674-7250/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test E/libOpenSLES: frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:785: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
06-28 15:38:30.505 6674-7250/org.cocos2dx.cpp_empty_test W/libOpenSLES: frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:785: pthread 0xd2561920 (tid 7250) sees object 0xe320a800 was locked by pthread 0xe8a7f920 (tid 6707) at frameworks/wilhelm/src/itf/IObject.c:411

```
It's a bug of Android System.
Please also refer to 
http://grokbase.com/t/gg/android-ndk/156tayqf1c/opensl-deadlock-issue
http://webmail.dev411.com/p/gg/android-ndk/154fhnm2ce/why-does-opensl-destroy-function-block-forever-on-some-devices
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/12479
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/11762

data.title: FileUtils::listFiles does not work on Win32
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: Windows 7
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

FileUtils::listFiles does not work on Win32 coz FileUtils::getFullPathForDirectoryAndFilename  will invoke _isFileExistInternal_ which in Win32 checks the _FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY_ attribution as follows:
    _if(attr == INVALID_FILE_ATTRIBUTES || (attr & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY))
        return false;   //  not a file_

Finally getFullPathForDirectoryAndFilename returns empty string and function listFiles does not work.
listFilesRecursively should have the same issue as well.

data.title: ccui.ScrollView did not send update event to script.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: 
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

ScrollView overrides update function, but did not call parent's update. 
So is lose the feature that send update event to the script engine.

When we call     
`node:scheduleUpdateWithPriorityLua(func, 0)` 
to register a function which will be called every frame.
It always valid, but not in scollview.

data.title: create project with precompild libraries
data.body:
**cocos2d-x-3.15.1
Cocos Console 2.3
ndk r15b
cocos installed from source code on ubuntu 16.04.**

I run
 `cocos gen-libs -c -p android --ap android-22 --app-abi x86`
 and then I'm trying to create new game using static libraries with 
`cocos new ProjectName -p projectname.com.name -l cpp -t binary` 
and it says 
`Template named 'binary' is not found`, while cocos `gen-templates` says 
```
Error: argument 'gen-templates' not found.
Try with cocos -h
```
What am I doing wrong?

data.title: Add controller support for Linux and Win32
data.body:
I think this should be merged after GLFW has been updated to 3.2.1 (Issue #17700), but for some strange reason this pull request works on my Windows machine without the GLFW update. Back on issue #16481 the joysticks didn't work on that same Windows machine I tested this code on.

There is a small trivial GLFW issue in 3.2.1 due to some hat buttons, or the D-pad on some controllers, being mapped as joystick axes. The workaround is trivial -- it's just a matter of identifying these buttons in the callbacks and mapping them to the respective functions these buttons should call. On GLFW 3.3, which is under development, the joystick API has been updated to provide a separate call to get the state of those hat buttons and as far as I can tell this code will have to be updated once GLFW 3.3 is stable and released with Cocos2D-X.

As far as I can tell the code in this pull request should also work on Mac, but it remains untested. I noticed there was already a game controller implementation for Mac and decided to leave it as is, just to not break any current projects that upgrade if this pull request gets merged.

One last issue is that the button key codes returned by GLFW differ greatly from the keys found in [Controller.h](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/base/CCController.h#L57-L93). There is no standard between the two controllers I tested the code with, and as a result I decided to leave it as is and not add any other key codes in there.

The code I used for testing this PR is currently here: https://github.com/Rubonnek/cocos2d-x-controller-test/tree/master/Classes

Just replace `HelloWorldScene.cpp` and `HelloWorldScene.h` in a new project and build. 

I'll add a controller test to cpp-tests later if needed.

data.title: touch stops responding on android devices
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: Galaxy S7, alcatel, galaxy J, moto G 2nd gen, emulator, armeabi, x86 or armeabi-v7a
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 15.0.4075724 (bundle)
   - Xcode version: 8.3.3 (8E3004b)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the app;
2. Do any Director::getInstance()->replaceScene();
3. Touch the screen;

After android discontinued some build commands, we were forced to update cocos2dx to the newest version, because we had to update some libraries too. After that, we started getting a ton of complaints about the screen being unresponsive. At this point 5% (1/20) sessions becomes unresponsive after the first replaceScene call. 

It doesn't matter what device, when the app is closed and reopened 20 times, we'll get at least 1 unresponsive state. 

How we proved this bug:
. We did EventListenerTouchAllAtOnce::create() with a simple CCLOG in the first and second scene.
It works perfectly 100% times in the first scene. After the first replaceScene is called, it works only 80% of all cases in the second scene.
. After downgrading cocos library to 3.14.1 it works 100% again.

var button = new ccui.Button("gui-gm-button-yellow.png", "", "", ccui.Widget.PLIST_TEXTURE).to(bg).pp(0.5, 0.2);
button.setTitleFontName("res/font/zhs-fz-52-yellow.fnt");

data.title: App turns into black screen on about 1/4 devices in batch test.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.15
- devices test on: 50 devices batch test on testin platform
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r14b
   - Xcode version:Version 8.3.3 (8E3004b)
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. compile my cocos2d-x app  with  --app-abi armeabi:armeabi-v7a:arm64-v8a:x86, make a package contains all 4 chip architecture library.
2. upload apk on testin platform and make a "standard compatable test", select random 50 devices.
3. when received the email of testin platform, browsed the test report, i found that the snapshots on about 1/4 devices are black screens.
4.compile my cocos2d-x app  with --app-abi armeabi, make the same test as steps 1,2,3, only one device is black screen.

data.title: Android fails to deploy APK on new project
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:
Tried it on both 3.14.1 and 3.15.1
- devices test on:
Windows 7
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r15
   - VS version: VS 2015 Update 3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new project using the following command:
`cocos new GameNameHere -p com.MyCompany.GameNameHere -l cpp -d pathtoproject`
2. Opening win32 project and building works fine and will run default application
3. Try and build an android APK using the following command:
`cocos deploy -p android` or 
`cocos deploy -p android --android-studio`
4. It will begin to build and half way it will error out with this message:

````
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp: In
constructor 'cocos2d::experimental::AudioDecoder::AudioDecoder(SLEngineItf, cons
t string&, int, int, const FdGetterCallback&)':
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp:108:
73: error: 'malloc' was not declared in this scope
     _pcmData = (char*) malloc(NB_BUFFERS_IN_QUEUE * BUFFER_SIZE_IN_BYTES);
                                                                         ^
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp: In
destructor 'virtual cocos2d::experimental::AudioDecoder::~AudioDecoder()':
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp:126:
18: error: 'free' was not declared in this scope
     free(_pcmData);
                  ^
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp: In
member function 'bool cocos2d::experimental::AudioDecoder::decodeToPcm()':
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp:405:
52: error: 'malloc' was not declared in this scope
         keyInfo = (SLMetadataInfo *) malloc(keySize);
                                                    ^
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp:434:
25: error: 'free' was not declared in this scope
             free(keyInfo);
                         ^
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp: In
member function 'bool cocos2d::experimental::AudioDecoder::resample()':
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp:504:
42: error: 'malloc' was not declared in this scope
     void *outputVAddr = malloc(outputSize);
                                          ^
D:/YourGame/cocos2d/cocos/audio/android/AudioDecoder.cpp:594:
17: error: 'free' was not declared in this scope
````

data.title: Test crash on Audio - NewAudioEngine:16
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: git
- devices test on: linux mint 18.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run `cpp-tests`.
2. Run 16'th test in `Audio - NewAudioEngine` section.
3. Got crash on test opening with `Illegal instruction (core dumped)` or `Segmentation fault (core dumped)`.

1. Follow installation instructions
2. Fail on `cmake ../..` step:

data.title: Mark warning as error
data.body:
This PR treat warning as error on iOS debug mode for engine module. Will treat warning as error in more platforms in future. 

It is better to do it in release mode too, but if do so then should modify debug mode to `release` as we want jenkins to make sure all PR will not import warnings. But i don't think use `release` mode by default is a good idea. It is better if can change to use release mode in command line, then jenkins can check both `debug` and `release` modes.

data.title: No window after install Debian
data.body:
Hey,
I have Debian 9 (Stretch). I followed the installation guide and compiled everything.
But now when I try to run cpp-empty-test or any other test - nothing happens. CPU is doing SOMETHING but no window, no error on terminal.
Does anyone know what is happening or at least how to get some info or error from the program?
PS: Tried install from this repo and it doesn't compile and says a lot of errors like "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.8' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC". The successful compile was from the download page for 3.15.1  
Edit:
I installed it on the same version on my laptop and it works, so I think it is because I use Nvidia drivers on the other PC. Can someone confirm that?
